alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued August 14 at 5:22PM MST until August 14 at 6:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 615 PM MST. * At 522 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Tumbleweed Park to near Maricopa, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 169 and 204. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 160 and 178. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 124 and 158. Locations impacted include... Casa Grande, Florence, Coolidge, Arizona City, La Palma, Blackwater, Toltec, Coolidge Airport, Bapchule, Olberg, Arizola, San Tan Mountain Park, Randolph, Valley Farms and Sacaton. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
